name: React
description: React makes it painless to create interactive UIs. Design simple views for each state in your application, and React will efficiently update and render just the right components when your data changes.React Docs: Click here

name: C#
description: C# is a general-purpose, object-oriented programming language designed for the Common Language Infrastructure. C# guide: Click here

name: HTML
description: HTML is the standard markup language for creating web pages and web applications. HTML describes the structure of a web page semantically and originally included cues for the appearance of the document.

name: CSS
description: CSS is a style sheet language used for describing the presentation of a document written in a markup language

name: Javascript ES6
description: ECMAScript 2015 is the sixth edition of the ECMAScript Language Specification standard. Initially referred to as ECMAScript 6 or ES6, it defines the standard for JavaScript implementation. More info: Click here

name: MVC
description: MVC gives a powerful, patterns-based way to build dynamic websites that enables a clean separation of concerns and that gives full control over markup for agile development. More info: Click here

name: SASS
description: SASS is an extension of CSS. Sass allows you to use things like variables, nested rules, inline imports and more. More info: Click here

name: NODE.js
description: Node is a server framework that uses JavaScript on the server. More info: Click here

name: Underscore.js
description: Underscore.js is a JavaScript library which provides utility functions for common programming tasks. More info: Click here

name: PostCSS
description: PostCSS provide a CSS parser and a framework for creating plugins that can analyse, lint, handle assets, optimise, create fallbacks, and otherwise transform parsed CSS. More info: Click here

name: AngularJS
description: AngularJS is a JavaScript framework that extends HTML attributes with Directives, and binds data to HTML with Expressions. More info: Click here

name: jQuery
description: jQuery is a cross-platform JavaScript library designed to simplify the client-side scripting of HTML. More info: Click here

name: MS WebForms
description: Web Forms is a part of the ASP.NET web application framework. It is one of the four programming models you can use to create ASP.NET web applications. More info: Click here

name: Flash
description: Flash displays text, vector graphics and raster graphics to provide animations, video games and applications. More info: Click here

name: Drupal
description: Drupal is an open source content-management framework written in PHP using the Symfony framework. More info: Click here

name: Sitecore
description: Sitecore is an award winning enterprise content management system. Delivering unparalleled ease of use, total flexibility, and enterprise-grade capabilities. More info: Click here

name: Google Analytics
description: Google Analytics Solutions offers enterprise analytics tools to measure website, app, digital and offline data to gain customer insights. More info: Click here

name: Umbraco
description: Umbraco is an open source content management system (CMS) platform written in C# and deployed on Microsoft based infrastructure. More info: Click here

name: EPiServer
description: Episerver offers web content management , digital commerce and digital marketing. More info: Click here

name: Continuous Integration
description: continuous integration is the practice of merging all developer working copies to a shared mainline several times a day. More info: Click here

name: Progressive enhancement
description: Progressive enhancement is a strategy for web design that emphasizes core webpage content first. This strategy then progressively adds more nuanced and technically rigorous layers of presentation and features on top of the content as the end-user's internet connection and browsers allow. More info: Click here

name: Responsive
description: Responsive is an approach to web design aimed at allowing desktop webpages to be viewed in response to the size of the screen or web browser one is viewing with. More info: Click here

name: Mobile first
description: Mobile First Responsive Design is a way of designing websites for Smaller Screens, and then progressively adjusts your design for devices with larger screens. More info: See Responsive

name: Style Sheet Driven design
description: Style Sheet Driven Design allows the designers and developers to ensure an underlying consistency across a site's pages. More info: Click here

name: Scrum / Agile
description: Scrum / agile is an iterative and incremental agile software development framework for managing product development. More info: Click here

name: Atomic Design
description: Atomic design is methodology for creating design systems with five distinct levels: Atoms, Molecules, Organisms, Templates and Pages. More info: Click here

name: Continuous Delivery
description: Continuous delivery is a software engineering approach in which teams produce software in short cycles, ensuring that the software can be reliably released at any time. More info: Click here

name: Scaffolding
description: Scaffolding is a technique supported by some model–view–controller frameworks, in which the developer can specify how the application database may be used.

name: Test Driven Development
description: Test-driven development is a software development process that relies on the repetition of a very short development cycle. Requirements are turned into very specific test cases.

name: Inversion of Control / Dependency Injection
description: dependency injection is a technique whereby one object supplies the dependencies of another object. A dependency is an object that can be used.

name: GIT
description: Git is a version control system for tracking changes in computer files and coordinating work on those files among multiple people. More info: Click here

name: GitHub
description: GitHub is a web-based Git or version control repository and Internet hosting service. It offers all of the distributed version control and source code management functionality of Git as well as adding its own features. More info: Click here

name: TargetProcess
description: Targetprocess is a visual project management software solution that focuses on the agile software development methodology. More info: Click here

name: NuGet
description: NuGet is an package manager designed for the Microsoft development platform. More info: Click here

name: Resharper
description: ReSharper is a popular developer productivity extension for Microsoft Visual Studio. It automates most of what can be automated in coding routines. More info: Click here

name: Selenium
description: Selenium is a software-testing framework for web applications. Selenium provides a record/playback tool for authoring tests without the need to learn a test scripting language More info: Click here

name: TeamCity
description: TeamCity is a Java-based build management and continuous integration server. More info: Click here

name: PatternLab
description: Pattern Lab is a static site generator, powered by either PHP or Node that stitches together UI components. More info: Click here

name: SonarQube
description: SonarQube is an open source platform for continuous inspection of code quality. More info: Click here

name: Gulp
description: Gulp is a JavaScript toolkit, used as a streaming build system in front-end web development.It is a task runner for automation of time-consuming and repetitive tasks More info: Click here

name: Webpack
description: Webpack is a module bundler. Its main purpose is to bundle JavaScript files for usage in a browser, yet it is also capable of running tasks. More info: Click here

name: Yarn
description: Yarn is a fast and secure dependency management for JavaScript dependencies. More info: Click here

name: Grunt
description: Grunt is a JavaScript task runner, a tool used to automatically perform frequently used tasks such as minification, compilation, unit testing, linting and more. More info: Click here

name: Bower
description: Bower is a package management system for client-side programming. It depends on Node.js and NPM. More info: Click here
